intro: Chorizanthe discolor, commonly known as the pale chori, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Chorizanthe discolor is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
